fine_dining.name: Gastromé
signature_dishes: Venison with foraged herbs and berries
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and intimate in a restored townhouse
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 months in advance, especially for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: One of Aarhus's most acclaimed restaurants; exceptional wine pairing option; seasonal menu changes regularly based on available local ingredients

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Frederikshøj
fine_dining.atmosphere: Refined and modern with minimalist décor
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 3-4 months in advance, closed Sundays and Mondays
fine_dining.local_tips: Headed by celebrity chef Wassim Hallal; extraordinary attention to detail; consider the juice pairing for a non-alcoholic option; complimentary shuttle service from central Aarhus

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Domestic
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2 months in advance, request counter seating to watch the kitchen
fine_dining.local_tips: Focus on hyper-local ingredients and traditional preservation techniques; excellent natural wine selection; intimate dining space with open kitchen

casual_dining.name: Aarhus Street Food
casual_dining.atmosphere: Vibrant indoor market in former bus garage
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations needed, but arrive outside peak hours to find seating
casual_dining.local_tips: Over 30 food stalls offering diverse cuisines; popular with locals; great for groups with different food preferences; lively weekend atmosphere

casual_dining.name: Langhoff & Juul
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy and hygge with rustic Danish design
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for brunch on weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Excellent for traditional Danish breakfast; focus on organic and local ingredients; beautiful interior design shop attached; popular with locals for business lunches

casual_dining.name: Café Smagløs
signature_dishes: Stegt flæsk med persillesovs (crispy pork with parsley sauce)
casual_dining.local_tips: Authentic Danish home-style cooking; generous portions; where locals go for traditional Danish cuisine; excellent value for money

casual_dining.name: Café Gaya
signature_dishes: Seasonal vegetable plates with Nordic herbs
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bright and airy with Scandinavian minimalism
casual_dining.booking_tips: Walk-ins welcome but arrive early for lunch rush
casual_dining.local_tips: Aarhus's best vegetarian restaurant; creative plant-based interpretations of Danish classics; excellent coffee program; peaceful atmosphere good for conversations

street_food.name: Havnegrillen
specialties: Danish hot dogs with traditional toppings
street_food.local_tips: Authentic Danish street food experience; where locals go for quick harbor-side meals; try the classic 'rød pølse' (red sausage) with all toppings

street_food.name: Café Gemmestedet
street_food.local_tips: Some of the city's best Danish pastries; seasonal specialties during holidays; perfect morning treat while exploring the Latin Quarter

street_food.name: Grød
street_food.local_tips: Denmark's famous porridge bar; transforms humble grains into gourmet meals; perfect healthy breakfast option; try the apple-cinnamon porridge with caramel sauce

coffee_shops.name: La Cabra
coffee_shops.local_tips: Internationally acclaimed coffee roaster; beans roasted on-site; multiple locations throughout Aarhus; flagship store offers brewing workshops

coffee_shops.name: Great Coffee
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy industrial with warm wooden elements
coffee_shops.local_tips: Perfect place to experience Danish coffee culture; excellent selection of beans; friendly baristas happy to discuss coffee preferences

coffee_shops.name: Café Fika
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Nordic café with hygge elements
coffee_shops.food_options: Traditional Danish pastries and open-faced sandwiches
coffee_shops.local_tips: Authentic Scandinavian 'fika' (coffee break) experience; no laptops policy encourages conversation; excellent place to experience hygge culture

bars.name: Mig & Ølsnedkeren
bars.atmosphere: Rustic beer hall with communal tables
bars.local_tips: Over 20 rotating taps featuring Danish craft brewers; knowledgeable bartenders offering samples; hidden courtyard seating in summer

bars.name: Aarhus Bryghus
bars.local_tips: Aarhus's premier local brewery; excellent guided tours with tastings; beer flight samplers available; friendly atmosphere with mix of locals and visitors

bars.name: St. Pauls Apothek
bars.atmosphere: Elegant former pharmacy with vintage details
bars.local_tips: Award-winning cocktail destination; located in a historic pharmacy; bartenders create custom drinks based on preferences; reservations essential on weekends

bars.name: Herr Bartels
bars.atmosphere: Authentic Danish brown bar with historic charm
bars.local_tips: Authentic Danish bodega experience; where locals gather; inexpensive drinks; traditional Danish drinking songs on weekend evenings; oldest bar in Aarhus

food_tours.name: Taste of Aarhus Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; tour includes substantial walking

food_tours.name: Nordic Gastronomy Experience
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead; focuses on contemporary Danish cuisine

food_tours.name: Craft Beer Journey
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 1-2 weeks ahead; includes substantial beer tastings; eat before the tour

cooking_classes.name: Danish Cooking Academy
includes: All ingredients, recipes, full meal with beer or wine pairing
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks ahead; classes held twice weekly

cooking_classes.name: New Nordic Workshop
includes: Premium ingredients, foraging excursion, multi-course meal with wine pairing
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book 3 weeks ahead; for enthusiasts with some cooking experience

markets.name: Aarhus Central Food Market
markets.hours: Tuesday to Saturday, 10 AM - 7 PM, Sunday 10 AM - 4 PM
markets.local_tips: Modern food hall with high-quality vendors; excellent lunch spot with diverse options; mixture of takeaway and eat-in options

markets.name: Ingerslevs Boulevard Market
markets.local_tips: Aarhus's largest traditional outdoor market; where locals shop for fresh ingredients; excellent for picnic supplies; vibrant atmosphere especially on Saturdays

markets.name: Aarhus Street Food
markets.hours: Monday to Thursday 12 PM - 9 PM, Friday to Saturday 12 PM - 10 PM, Sunday 12 PM - 7 PM
markets.local_tips: Vibrant covered market in former bus garage; over 30 food stalls; popular with locals and students; great evening atmosphere with communal seating

spring: Nye kartofler med smør (new potatoes with butter and dill)
Ramsløg (wild garlic) featured in seasonal dishes
summer: Smørrebrød with fresh local vegetables and herbs
autumn: Seasonal root vegetables with traditional preparations
